7549038963286182980.title: IT Infrastructure Service Delivery Manager
7549038963286182980.text:
IT Infrastructure Service Delivery Manager
Location: Warszawa

Kamil from Lublin
Tasks
~Organize and lead the work of delivery team as a manager and a mentor
~Meet or exceed Client's needs, maintain high Clients satisfaction rating
~Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned Clients, maintain good long-term relationships
~Take care about increasing business in selling services (promote Sii offer, obtain business information about clients and competitors, up-selling - creating new needs among Sii Clients)
~Identify and develop valuable ideas, share knowledge, deliver information, take part in conferences, job fairs workshops and training
~Support HR Department in following tasks: recruitment (if possible take part in selected recruitment interviews with candidates), identify most talented engineers, plan and organize the work of a team, motivate and team build, manage employees performance assessments
~Prepare Technical & Commercial offers, help to build winning offers in cooperation with Sii PSD, Sales Department, Sii Experts
~Act as expert to resolve complex issues and provide suggestions on improvements:


Required profile
~At least 2 years' experience on similar position within IT service delivery
~At least 5 years' experience working as a Microsoft Systems Administrator
~Advanced knowledge of Active Directory, AD related projects experience will be a benefit
~Advanced knowledge of Microsoft technologies – on premise and cloud solutions service delivery
~Master Degree
~Knowledge of issues, methodologies and tools for systems' architectures, business processes and data modeling
~Good understanding of IT services' market and sales process
~Relevant experience in project and/or service delivery management
~Experience in managing the relationship with customers
~Excellent analytical skills
~Good knowledge of English
~Professional approach to work, strong sense of responsibility
~Determination, proactivity, ambition, teamwork, positive attitude


We offer
~The chance to participate in major and most advanced technical projects and to improve constantly your skills and competences
~Possibility to join the Best Place to Work in IT in Poland, awarded with Great Place to Work and Computerworld AudIT prizes
~Opportunity for professional development
~Competitive salary
~Independent and responsible work
~Attractive social benefits (private health service, insurance, tickets to cinema, etc…)
~Trainings, English courses
~Stable employment
~Comfortable location of the SII office


Interested individuals are encouraged to send their resume with reference number to :
rekrutacja-warszawa@pl.sii.eu
together with an approval for the processing of personal data listed below:
„I hereby agree for the processing of my personal data by Sii Sp. z o. o, Al. Niepodległości 69, 02-626 Warszawa, enclosed in the application documents submitted by me, including their processing in the future - for the purpose of the recruitment process. This consent is submitted voluntarily and I declare that I have been informed of the powers I am entitled to in accordance with the Protection of Personal Data Act from August 29, 1997 (consolidated version: Journal of Laws from 2002, No. 101., item 926. with amendments".
Please note that we will contact only selected candidates.

2521675979083677853.title: Педагог
2521675979083677853.text: . Удобный график работы. Достойная оплата труда, премии по результатам работы. Для сотрудников проводятся стажировки, семинары, тренинги. Отличная возможность профессионального и карьерного роста. Работа с небольшими группами до 8 деток. Дружный коллектив. Удобное месторасположение В центр детского развития «Уникальные дети» требуется педагог дополнительного образования. Мы ищем не просто сотрудника, а единомышленника. Если вы добрая мама или сестренка и еще педагог по образованию, любите детей, общаетесь с ними легко и непринужденно. То у вас есть великолепная возможность заниматься любимым делом. Звоните и расскажите о себе и о том почему хотите работать у нас и мы обязательно поговорим с вами и договоримся о встречи для более подробной беседы. Карьерный рост. Оплачиваемый отпуск. На территории работодателя. Корпоративное обучение. Дружелюбный коллектив. Испытательный срок. Социальный пакет. Наличие образования. Опыт работы. Без вредных привычек. Прохождение медосмотра. Опыт работы не менее 1 года. Образование: желательно педагогическое ( психолог, логопед, педагог начальных классов, воспитатель и др.), но не обязательно. Общительный, энергичный, гибкий человек с позитивным жизненным настроем, с хорошим чувством юмора, любящий детей и умеющий найти к ним подход. Приветствуются новаторские способности, умение импровизировать, а также стремление работать, познавать новое и зарабатывать. Ответственность, аккуратность, организованность, пунктуальность. Соблюдение методики обучения. Приветствуется знание различных методик развития Обязанности. Проведение занятий детям преимущественно от 4 до 16 лет в игровой форме в радостной, позитивной атмосфере. Осуществление творческих преобразований предложенных программ. Подготовка помещения к занятиям. Обязательное общение с родителями. Участие в жизни центра. Постоянное развитие и совершенствование как своей работы, так и своей личности. Беспрекословное выполнение своих должностных обязанностей и…

Компания «МИЛАВИЦА», один из крупнейших производителей корсетных изделий в Восточной Европе, в связи с развитием производства создаёт новые рабочие места и приглашает ШВЕЙ на работу в г.Минск.

Обязанности:
~пошив женского белья, корсетных, трикотажных изделий и купальников.

Наши требования:
~желателен опыт работы с трикотажем,
~знание швейного оборудования,
~хорошее зрение,
~развитая мелкая моторика рук, подвижность пальцев, умение работать с мелкими деталями (увлечение шитьём, вышиванием, вязанием, лепкой, мозаикой или другими видами рукоделия)
~готовность к высокой интенсивности труда, освоению нового ассортимента и оборудования.

Условия:
~комфортные и современно оборудованные рабочие места,
~оплата сдельно-премиальная (средняя зарплата швей более 600 рублей),
~при отсутствии профессии предлагаем обучение 3 мес. с выплатой ученических 240 руб. + оплата за сделанную работу,
~для новых швей устанавливаем доплаты за освоение ассортимента в течение первого года работы,
~иногородним предоставляем общежитие,
~предоставляем социальные льготы и гарантии в соответствии с коллективным договором (материальная помощь к отпуску, на строительство жилья, к юбилейным и другим личным датам, путевки на оздоровление детей, детские новогодние подарки, бесплатные занятия по фитнесу, корпоративные мероприятия и др.)
~график работы сменный по неделям (6.45-15.05, 15.10-23.30), сб., вс. – выходные.

Приглашаем посмотреть условия работы по адресу ул.Нововиленская, г.Минск.
Ждем умелых мастериц/мастеров, мечтающих приобщиться к созданию прекрасного белья для современных женщин!

-1196656013990002488.title: Digital Analytics Expert
-1196656013990002488.text:
Citi Service Center (CSC) is an initiative to establish a network of service centers providing high quality services to other entities operating within the Citi Group.
Citi Service Center Poland was founded in 2005, and it currently employs over 3000 highly qualified staff in three locations: Warsaw, Olsztyn and Lodz. CSC cooperates with other Citi entities from all over the world.
Currently we provide services to over 60 countries in Europe, Asia, Africa, both Americas and Australia. Our employees use over 24 languages every day. Working in our organization involves working on international projects, in an international and dynamic environment as well as learning the top quality organizational culture.   Candidates interested in this job position are asked to apply by the Citi Careers Apply button below
  Read more about career opportunities at: careeratciti.pl or facebook.com/citigradsemea 

Citi Service Center Poland


 Digital Analytics Expert

Work place: Warszawa
16081092
Description

~Ensure development and execution of digitalization strategy.
~Identify available information to help an enterprise to drive business to digital age.
~Driving the organization to the next level of digitalization by using Big Data technics and tools.
~Delivering Digital channel analysis, customer post and pre login behavior.
~Understanding customer needs by enhancing SitCatalyst reporting with other departments.
~CRM marketing & sales campaigns reporting in order to maximize profitability from Digital campaigns and customer satisfaction.
~Segmenting of the Digital Customers to enable tailored and relevant marketing messages – personalized and contextualized offers.
~Analysis return on investment through KPI’s and performance metrics from Digital activities.
~Responsibility for preparation and realization of reporting and analytical solutions for Digital processes (i.e. COP).
~Creating propensity models for Digital customers and products.


Qualifications

~Education Level: Master's Degree         
~Strong analytical skills, ability to analyze many problems from various perspectives.
~Very good understanding of Digital acquisition, activation and engagement specifics.
~Economics/Maths/Statistics/IT university education.
~Good understanding of statistics and building regression models
~Experience in work with big data sets
~Knowledge on how to manage data elements
~Very good written and spoken English.
~Very good work organization.
~Very good communication skills.
~Very good SQL and SAS/4GL skills.
~SAS Miner/R knowledge nice to have.
~Presentation skills, including data visualization and communication.
~Being data driven problem solver


Please be informed that we will contact selected candidates only.
You are kindly requested to include the following clause in your application: “I hereby give my consent to the processing of my personal data included in my job application for the purpose of the recruitment process and after its completion for the purpose of future recruitments (pursuant to the Personal Data Protection Act as of 29 August 1997, Journal of Laws No. 133, item 883).

5354702613790414155.title: Junior Accountant with Spanish
5354702613790414155.text:
Junior Accountant with Spanish
Place of work: Katowice, Krakow
About us
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology and outsourcing services.
Capgemini Business Services department is one of the first and the biggest outsourcing centers in Poland providing services in 30 different languages in the areas of: finance, accounting, banking, procurement, customer care and marketing services. Business Services employs over 3800 specialists in its offices located in Krakow and Katowice.

Key responsibilities
~Correct and timely processing of financial data
~Processing purchase invoices and credit notes
~Analyzing the accounting documentation
~Correct and timely reporting
~Effective cooperation with Clients and colleagues


Ideal candidate profile
~At least intermediate level of English (min. B1)
~At least intermediate level of Spanish (min. B1)
~Focus on details
~Good analytical skills
~Multitasking and ability to meet deadlines
~Working knowledge of MS Office tools (especially Excel)


What we offer
~Work in multinational company for c.a. 100 Blue Chip Clients- known, global brands, supported by 6000  professionals in 30 languages.
~Clearly defined career path  (experts or managers), wide range of trainings - over 20 000 online trainings and books also available at home, trainings in classroom, funding for learning foreign languages.
~You will learn best practices and global business from Capgemini experts. Over 900 certificated professionals in the field of PMP, SAP, ACCA, etc.
~You will work in an inspiring atmosphere. We work together and celebrate together- Capgemini Theatre, employee volunteer program, integration events, sports events (basketball, volleyball) - everyone will find something for themselves!
~In addition to the salary you will receive attractive benefit package  (medical care for whole family, life insurance), flexible forms of employment  (FLEXI Program). You can recommend friends in Referral Program  and collect awards!
~Our offices are conveniently located with “Bicycle-friendly” certificate!
~As a disabled person you will get professional support. We are open to provide assistive technologies for people with diverse disabilities. We care about inclusion and equal rights approach. We conduct disability awareness trainings. Join our Win with Capgemini Program for people with disabilities.


Interested candidates are invited to apply online.
Please be advised that Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. located in Warsaw, Al. Jerozolimskie 96, is the controller of personal data provided by you in the recruitment applications. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act of 29 August 1997 (Journal of Laws2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments) for the purpose of existing and future recruitment processes. Please be advised that in scope of recruitment process your personal data will be processed by the controller and sub-processors located outside European Economic Area including India’s entity. Data submission is voluntary. Every person has the right to access their data in order to correct it or delete it”
 Please include following statement in your application: "I hereby authorize Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. to process my personal data included in my job application for existing and future recruitment processes (in accordance with the Personal Data Protection August 1997, Journal of Laws 2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments).I also authorize Capgemini Poland Sp z o.o. to sub-process my personal data outside European Economic Area including India’s entity, which may also include Capgemini’s clients within and outside of EEA."
 We protect your privacy. We kindly inform you that we contact only chosen candidates.The recruitment process is conducted in accordance with the principles of equal treatment in employment, Labor Code, Chapter IIa, Art. 183a– 183e.

-43676650771573072.title: Regional Sales Manager- Large Format Industrial-Graphic Solutions Business
-43676650771573072.title_normalized: regiona sales larg format solutions business
-43676650771573072.text:
Regional Sales Manager- Large Format Industrial-Graphic Solutions Business
Location: Warsaw
Description -
Today HP is a fortune 50 company and with 50,000 employees worldwide across 190 countries. HP is about innovation, it’s who we are and what we have been doing since 1939. We keep reinventing ourselves, together we challenge convention, pushing each other to surprise the world.
At our Warsaw site you will find, 100+ employees and a demo centre. As an Indirect Regional Sales Manager you will be part of a dedicated European team making the market transition from analogue to digital in the corrugated packaging world.
About you:
~Complexity is not new to you, from complex sales cycles to the complexity of getting buy-ins from key stakeholders
~You have a consultative approach when solution selling
~It’s in your nature hunt, to be out of the office visiting clients, you are used to travelling 70% +
~You are considered a top performer by your peers, achieving/over exceeding your quotas
~Always  ahead of the game by acquiring knowledge of products, solutions and services, both internally and from the competition

Experience:
~You have experience in selling products and solutions to small, medium and large organizations dealing with C-level audience.
~You know how to sell high value technical/complex hardware,  $1 million+
~Due to your experienced in managing complex, long sales cycles you have developed outstanding planning and project management skills
~It would an advantage if you had a good understanding of printing and finishing processes in the corrugated packaging market.

Key responsibilities:
~Responsible for all Large Format Industrial sales within corrugated, sign & display customers in Poland
~Sell complete Large Format Industrial portfolio within HP named accounts, and channels.
~Apply consultative-selling techniques to identify and advance opportunities that result in ongoing profitable revenue
~Maintain high-level of customer loyalty, build trust and integrative relationships.
~Develop business plans in conjunction with the customer; coordinate all account forecasts, planning and reporting.
~Influencing the market transition from analog to digital technology.
~Analyze existing production workflow to build the right value proposition for the digital transformation in print and production.
~Identify and execute sales opportunities within its existing customers and new prospects.
~Actively participate in sales events (sales meetings, international exhibitions, conferences etc)
~Work closely with Large Format Production & Indigo teams in pursuit of cross selling opportunities and alignment
~Quota achievement across all product lines; Hardware, Ink and Services
~Continuously maintain, update sales and funnel data in Sales Force for best predictability and sales funnel management

Education, Skills and skills: 
~Fluency in Polish and English is mandatory

~University or Bachelor's Degree, Masters is an advantage
~8+ years of experience with extraordinarily strong track record of account management and sales performance

We are offering

~Working in an international company
~Opportunity to develop career path in organizational structures
~Flexible time schedule
~Modern and friendly work environment with open door policy
~Professional trainings
~Social benefits
~Competitive salary and flexible working hours
~Private medical care
~Benefit sport system
~Life insurance
~Extend Wellness Program


Make it happen today! Apply at hp.com/jobs

Make sure you insert the following statement along with your CV:
I hereby authorize you to process my personal data included in my
job application for the needs of the recruitment process (in accordance
with the Personnel Protection Act of 29.08.1997 no 133 position 883).

9007642339484203130.title: Водитель
9007642339484203130.text: Требуются водители, которые не боятся начать легально подрабатывать на своем автомобиле в "Аренде авто с водителем" (такси для начинающих) в Минске, Минском районе и области. Работаем с ведущими службами такси. Для работы в АА вам не нужно курсов таксиста, таксометра, 2-го техосмотра и других дорогостоящих процедур. Полное техническое сопровождение и оборудование устройствами для работы, магниты. Обучим, поможем в оформлении за 1 день. Врач/Механик в 5 точках города круглосуточно. Внимание: платежи ниже, чем у конкурентов, касса в залог за 50%. Работа на себя, перевозчику - налоги и за связь. Желание работать - и вы заработаете на вашем авто любого года выпуска. Звоните по будням с 9.00 до 17.00. Перевозка пассажиров такси по городу

-1516102716311742093.title: IT & TELCO Procurement Sourcing Specialist - German Speaker
-1516102716311742093.title_normalized: telc procurement sourcing specialist germa speaker
-1516102716311742093.text:
IT & TELCO Procurement Sourcing Specialist - German Speaker
Place of work: Krakow
About us
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology and outsourcing services.
Capgemini Business Services department is one of the first and the biggest outsourcing centers in Poland providing services in 30 different languages in the areas of: finance, accounting, banking, procurement, customer care and marketing services. Business Services employs over 3800 specialists in its offices located in Krakow and Katowice.

Position purpose
Capgemini Group is opening a new  Global Procurement Project in Krakow that will focus on European sourcing activities, managing supplier performance and binging value to the Capgemini Global organization.  By joining the fist members of the team you will have a chance to cooperate  with  the global procurement professionals, built new structures and teams in Krakow office and have direct impact on the strategic sourcing management.

Roles and responsibilities
~Provide souring activities in IT & Telco category for German speaking  countries
~Cooperate with global IT& Telco procurement category Leads  
~Implement global frame agreements in European Countries – German speaking
~Support supply chain management
~Manage complaints and vendor relationship
~Verification and post –signing management of contracts
~Deploying global Service Level Agreements and Master Service Agreements
~Cost optimization and providing saving initiatives
~Acting as subject matter expert for the supported country
~Understand and drive adoption of procurement policies and processes 


Requirements
~2-3 years of Strategic Sourcing experience in Procurement
~Interest in IT & Telco Category
~Bidding management experience – preferably for different localizations and departments
~Global team work experience
~Strong Client Relationship management
~Ability work comfortably under pressure 
~Proven ability to communicate, negotiate and influence at all levels 
~Proven ability in strategic innovation and problem solving 
~Advanced knowledge of Excel
~Fluent command of GERMAN C1 level or higher (your daily activates will require contact with native speakers) plus ENGLISH B2 or higher
~Skilled at building reports, executive presentations for senior level management
~Independent in decision-making (as you will operate on budgets up to several thousand Euros)
~Demonstrate exemplary integrity and ethics in all instances


What we offer
~You will work in multinational, stable company for c.a. 100 Blue Chip Clients - known, global brands, supported by 6000 professionals in 30 languages.
~You will gain space to fulfill your ambitions and develop your career, opportunity to take part in transition projects. We operate according to Lean and Kaizen philosophy.
~You will choose your career path (experts or managers) – you will work among professionals (over 900). We will support you to gain knowledge (20 000 online trainings and in class) and get certified  (e.g. ACCA, Prince2, PMP). You will have the opportunity to take part in coaching programs and develop your knowledge in experts communities.
~You will work in line with high, international work standards and you will have an opportunity to engage in CSR initiatives.
~You will be appreciated for your results and professionalism – based on clear rules of promotion. Our company applies a wide choice of perks (free private medical care for you and your family, additional life insurance). We help to keep right proportions between your work and private life (Business Parent Program).
~As a disabled person you will get professional support. We are open to provide assistive technologies for people with diverse disabilities. We care about inclusion and equal rights approach. We conduct disability awareness trainings. Join our Win with Capgemini Program for people with disabilities.


Interested candidates are invited to apply online.
Please be advised that Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. located in Warsaw, Al. Jerozolimskie 96, is the controller of personal data provided by you in the recruitment applications. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act of 29 August 1997 (Journal of Laws2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments) for the purpose of existing and future recruitment processes. Please be advised that in scope of recruitment process your personal data will be processed by the controller and sub-processors located outside European Economic Area including India’s entity. Data submission is voluntary. Every person has the right to access their data in order to correct it or delete it”
 Please include following statement in your application: "I hereby authorize Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. to process my personal data included in my job application for existing and future recruitment processes (in accordance with the Personal Data Protection August 1997, Journal of Laws 2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments).I also authorize Capgemini Poland Sp z o.o. to sub-process my personal data outside European Economic Area including India’s entity, which may also include Capgemini’s clients within and outside of EEA."
 We protect your privacy. We kindly inform you that we contact only chosen candidates.The recruitment process is conducted in accordance with the principles of equal treatment in employment, Labor Code, Chapter IIa, Art. 183a– 183e.

-2096369262910561958.title: Java Developer / Senior Java Developer
-2096369262910561958.text:
Java Developer / Senior Java Developer
Location: Gdańsk

Kamil from Lublin
Tasks
Become a member of the team working for one of the biggest sportswear brands. Build with us a new generation of our Customer’s core systems, where every single one of their products begins its life.

~Developing, coding, testing and debugging complex software solutions in order to improve core business processes
~Cooperating with global staff to better understand
~Customer’s requirements and needs
~Acting as our Customer’s consultant – helping out in solving complicated issues (conceptual work, Proofs of Concept etc.) 
~Proactively suggesting improvements to existing functionalities
~Assisting in development of technical documentation


Required profile
~At least 3/5 years of experience in software development
~Experience as a Software Architect will be an advantage
~Excellent knowledge of Java
~Experience in design and full-stack development of enterprise-level applications
~Familiarity with advanced software development challenges (performance, scalability, security)
~Experience with JavaEE (incl. EJB, JPA), Hibernate, SQL is a must
~Knowledge of Vaadin framework will be a significant advantage
~Degree in engineering, preferably in the specialization of software, telecommunications or electronics
~Experience in working in Agile project setup
~Very good knowledge of English


We offer
~Project team located in Gdańsk – Olivia Business Centre ()
~Opportunity for professional development
~Attractive salary adequate to the skills and experience
~Stable employment
~Attractive social package
~Excellent work atmosphere
~Stable employment in the best IT workplace in Poland!


Interested individuals are encouraged to send their resume with reference number to :
rekrutacja-gdansk@pl.sii.eu

This consent is submitted voluntarily and I declare that I have been informed of the powers I am entitled to in accordance with the Protection of Personal Data Act from August 29, 1997 (consolidated version: Journal of Laws from 2002, No. 101., item 926. with amendments".
Please note that we will contact only selected candidates.

-6111203990918583614.title: Financial Reporting Accountant
-6111203990918583614.text:
State Street Corporation: Across the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. We keep our clients at the heart of everything we do, and smart, engaged employees are essential to our continued success.
Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.
At the moment we are looking for candidates for the position of
 Financial Reporting Accountant JOB ID:   144438
Location: Krakow

to join the insource organization supporting the State Street EMEA
Why State Street Bank Poland?
Operating in Europe since 1970 State Street services clients in multiple locations. State Street Bank Poland was first established in 2007 in Kraków. Today State Street Bank Poland employs over 2500 staff members at three sites across the city and will now open a new office in Gdańsk. This will offer multiple opportunities to gain experience in diverse areas of the investment fund cycle as our Poland branch provides investment fund accounting and related services to clients of multiple State Street locations and business units across Europe. We offer positions in a challenging, rapidly changing and international environment. State Street offers a significant scope for personal growth and career progression. Throughout your career at State Street you will be provided with a wide range of training opportunities and internal mobility options as well as individual development plans, attractive benefits (including Employee Savings Plan) and an excellent remuneration package. The continuous development of our employees from day one is critical as we continually seek to develop and expand the local management team and create future leaders from within.
Job Description:
​ Purpose of the Position:
Financial Reporting Accountant is reporting to a Team Supervisor of the Financial Reporting Team in Poland, this position offers an opportunity for the successful candidate to develop their existing knowledge of financial accounting with a leading fund administrator.
Responsibilities:
~Prepare template financial statements for annual and interim cycle using the standard operating procedure
~Prepare and complete first draft of audited annual and unaudited interim financial statements from trial balance
~including Profit and Loss Account, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow, Schedule of Investments, notes to financial statements
~Prepare audit files and in line with standard operating procedure
~Prepare reconciliations in line with standard operating procedure. (book cost, capital gain and capital stock)
~Process changes accurately to financial statements as communicated by SSIIL staff
~Work to tight deadlines in order to meet clients reporting timelines
~Maintain and develop relationships with Financial Reporting

Qualifications:
~Good command of English
~Graduate with an accounting qualification or partly qualified with recognised financial accounting qualification
~Experience within the funds industry would be a distinct advantage
~Aptitude for figures
~PC literate with excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Word and Excel
~Have a thorough understanding of basic accounting principles together
~Have an enquiring mind and a willingness to investigate and solve problems
~Experience of working to deadlines
~Excellent analytical and organizational skills
~Quick in thinking, reflection and execution

To apply to this position, follow the "apply now" link. To locate this position in our application page, please use the KEYWORD search functionality and insert either the State Street Job ID or the Location.
As a first step we ask all candidates to fill out our online application form. Please enclose the CV in English and remember to save this document without any Polish characteristics also in file name.
To apply for the position please visit our website 
Job ID: 144438 / Location: Krakow


State Street Bank Polska

5626465709193924968.title: Senior Fund Accountant, Associate 2, Gdansk
5626465709193924968.text:
State Street Corporation: Across the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. We keep our clients at the heart of everything we do, and smart, engaged employees are essential to our continued success.
Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.
At the moment we are looking for candidates for the position of
 Senior Fund Accountant, Associate 2, Gdansk  JOB ID:   118754
Location: Gdańsk

to join the insource organization supporting the State Street EMEA
Why State Street Bank Poland?
Operating in Europe since 1970 State Street services clients in multiple locations. State Street Bank Poland was first established in 2007 in Kraków. Today State Street Bank Poland employs over 2500 staff members at three sites across the city and will now open a new office in Gdańsk. This will offer multiple opportunities to gain experience in diverse areas of the investment fund cycle as our Poland branch provides investment fund accounting and related services to clients of multiple State Street locations and business units across Europe. We offer positions in a challenging, rapidly changing and international environment. State Street offers a significant scope for personal growth and career progression. Throughout your career at State Street you will be provided with a wide range of training opportunities and internal mobility options as well as individual development plans, attractive benefits (including Employee Savings Plan) and an excellent remuneration package. The continuous development of our employees from day one is critical as we continually seek to develop and expand the local management team and create future leaders from within.
Job Description:
Purpose Of Role:
Preparation of reconciliations integral to the daily accounting and Dealing Date accounting process.
Specific Duties:
~Preparation of daily cash, position and market value reconciliations including trade capture and pricing
~Assist in the Dealing Date accounting process
~Assist in reviewing and resolving reconciliations of portfolio cash and security accounts
~Opportunity to work on corporate actions, equities, fixed income, futures, options and swaps and complex financial instruments
~Assist in semi-annual and annual audit process
~Handle more complex tasks
~Provide advice and serve as a point of reference for queries from junior fund accountants
~During the course of normal day to day operation, responsible for identifying any unusual or potentially suspicious transaction activity and must report and/or escalate in accordance with corporate policy and guidelines detailed in relevant operating procedures.

Qualifications:
Specific Qualifications/ Skills:
~Highly numerate
~IT Literate
~Strong verbal and written communication skills
~Strong analytical skills
~Ability to perform effectively within strict client deadlines.

Level Of Education:
~Degree in Accounting or Finance or Business related area (minimum 2.2 honors degree).
~ACCA/CIMA/ACA/CPA qualified or part qualified an advantage.

Critical Behaviors for Success as defined
Core Competencies
~Good numerical and analytical abilities
~Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
~Excellent attention to detail
~Good communicator, both verbal and written
~Team player
~Prepared to work flexible working hours
~Excellent English

Disposition
~Self motivated
~Enthusiastic
~Self-reliant

To apply to this position, follow the "apply now" link. To locate this position in our application page, please use the KEYWORD search functionality and insert either the State Street Job ID or the Location.
As a first step we ask all candidates to fill out our online application form. Please enclose the CV in English and remember to save this document without any Polish characteristics also in file name.
To apply for the position please visit our website 
Job ID: 118754 / Location: Gdańsk


State Street Bank Polska

-2983059846222642683.title: Oracle Database Consultant
-2983059846222642683.text:
Oracle Database Consultant
Place of work: Katowice, Krakow
About us
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology and outsourcing services.
Cloud Infrastructure Services is one of the biggest outsourcing service providers in Poland. Since the establishment of our first service center in Krakow in 2004, it has achieved great success and grown rapidly. In 2006, we opened a second center in Katowice and in 2012 a third center in Opole. Today, our team of 2,000 professionals delivers IT outsourcing services to 40 clients in 20 languages.

Position purpose
Consulting services related to Oracle DataBase.

Job description
~Installing and upgrading the Oracle server and application tools
~Allocating system storage and planning future storage requirements for the database system
~Creating primary database storage structures (tablespaces) after application developers have designed an application
~Creating primary objects (tables, views, indexes) once application developers have designed an application
~Modifying the database structure, as necessary, from information given by application developers
~Enrolling users and maintaining system security
~Ensuring compliance with your Oracle license agreement
~Controlling and monitoring user access to the database
~Monitoring and optimizing the performance of the database
~Planning for backup and recovery of database information
~Monitoring and managing high availability solution of Oracle
~Backing up and restoring the database
~Contacting Oracle Corporation for technical support


Requirements
Essential:
~At least 3 years’ experience as an Oracle DBA in a complex IT environment and at database design and architecture
~Considerable knowledge of Oracle, Oracle internals, installation and configuration
~Experience in analyzing performance test data
~Strong Database performance tuning of large systems
~Experience with SQL, PL/SQL programming and tuning
~Oracle upgrade experience
~Familiarity with Partitioning, OEM
~Writing and maintaining infrastructure documentation
~Experience with process-oriented work (ITIL) within an customer environment
~Experience with and knowledge of the latest Oracle Fusion Middleware components: Oracle WebLogic Server (clustering and other HA technologies such as Active Grid Link)
~Experience with Oracle high available solutions like RAC and DataGuard
~Understanding a Solaris and Oracle storage concepts including Automatic Storage Management (ASM), storage pools etc.
~Understanding a Oracle RAC network concept including Interconnect network

Nice to have:
~Linux (Oracle Enterprise Linux or other flavors such as RedHat)
~Experience with Oracle Solaris Virtualization (SPARC)
~Knowledge and experience with tools like Oracle Enterprise Management
~/ Apache knowledge
~Java


What we offer
~You will work in multinational, stable company for c.a. 100 Blue Chip Clients - known, global brands, supported by 6000professionals in 30 languages
~You will gain space to fulfill your ambitions and develop your career, opportunity to take part in transition projects. We operate according to Lean and Kaizen philosophy.
~You will choose your career path (experts or managers) – you will work among professionals (over 900). We will support you to gain knowledge (20 000 online trainings and in class) and get certified (e.g. ITIL, Vmware, Citrix,
~Oracle Database). You will have the opportunity to take part in coaching programs and develop your knowledge in experts communities.
~You will work in line with high, international work standards and you will have an opportunity to engage in CSR initiatives.
~You will be appreciated for your results and professionalism – based on clear rules of promotion. Our company applies awide choice of perks (free private medical care for you and your family, additional life insurance). We help to keep right proportions between your work and private life (Business Parent Program).


Interested candidates are invited to apply online.
Please be advised that Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. located in Warsaw, Al. Jerozolimskie 96, is the controller of personal data provided by you in the recruitment applications. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act of 29 August 1997 (Journal of Laws2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments) for the purpose of existing and future recruitment processes. Please be advised that in scope of recruitment process your personal data will be processed by the controller and sub-processors located outside European Economic Area including India’s entity. Data submission is voluntary. Every person has the right to access their data in order to correct it or delete it”
 Please include following statement in your application: "I hereby authorize Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. to process my personal data included in my job application for existing and future recruitment processes (in accordance with the Personal Data Protection August 1997, Journal of Laws 2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments).I also authorize Capgemini Poland Sp z o.o. to sub-process my personal data outside European Economic Area including India’s entity, which may also include Capgemini’s clients within and outside of EEA."
 We protect your privacy. We kindly inform you that we contact only chosen candidates.The recruitment process is conducted in accordance with the principles of equal treatment in employment, Labor Code, Chapter IIa, Art. 183a– 183e.

-502905111966448410.title: Senior Auditor - FX and Local Markets
-502905111966448410.text:
Citi Service Center (CSC) is an initiative to establish a network of service centers providing high quality services to other entities operating within the Citi Group.
Citi Service Center Poland was founded in 2005, and it currently employs over 3000 highly qualified staff in three locations: Warsaw, Olsztyn and Lodz. CSC cooperates with other Citi entities from all over the world.
Currently we provide services to over 60 countries in Europe, Asia, Africa, both Americas and Australia. Our employees use over 24 languages every day. Working in our organization involves working on international projects, in an international and dynamic environment as well as learning the top quality organizational culture.   Candidates interested in this job position are asked to apply by the Citi Careers Apply button below
  Read more about career opportunities at: careeratciti.pl or facebook.com/citigradsemea 

Citi Service Center Poland


 Senior Auditor – FX and Local Markets

Work place: Warszawa
16067867
Description

Function background/context:
Internal Audit is a global organization of over 1500 professionals covering Citi's global businesses and service to clients and customers in over 180 countries. Citi's Internal Audit division provides independent assessments of the company's governance, risk management and internal control environment for key stakeholders including the Board of Directors, senior management and Citi’s numerous regulators globally. Internal Audit is a change agent within Citi aimed to enhance the control culture of Citigroup worldwide and thereby support senior management decision making around the globe.

Job Purpose:
This role directs the timely delivery of high quality; value added assurance and audit reports for a portfolio of business activities, which meet the requirements of the Boards of Citigroup and Citibank, their affiliates, and of Citi’s respective regulators, globally.
The FX and Local Markets rates business is a key business within Global Markets, present in 83 countries globally. The business trades and facilitates local and international client demand for both flow and derivative products in Global FX and local rates (non-G10) markets.
 
Key Responsibilities:
• As a seasoned professional applies solid understanding of internal audit standards, policies, and local regulations to provide timely audit assurance.
• Contributes to the development of audit processes improvements.
• Applies solid understanding of how internal audit collectively integrates with line management and control functions to accomplish the objectives of the function and overall business.
• Performs moderately complex audits related to FX and Local Markets, in accordance with corporate methodologies and professional standards, including drafting of audit reports, presenting issues to the business and discussing practical solutions.
• Completes assigned audits within budgeted timeframes, and budgeted costs.
• Provides coaching to team members in all phases of the audit process.
• Monitors the risk environment and assesses the emerging risks through the Business Monitoring process.
• Recommends appropriate and pragmatic solutions to risk and control issues.
• Applies knowledge of key regulations to influence audit scope.
• Develops effective line management relationships to ensure strong understanding of the business.
• Pro-actively develops automated routines to help focus audit testing.
• Completes other audit related and administrative tasks as allocated by the manager or superior.
Qualifications

Requirements:
• BA/BS or equivalent.
• Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) are a plus.
• Intermediate level experience in a related role with experience in business, with proven abilities in taking responsibility for issuing to stakeholders high quality deliverables according to strict timetables.
• Solid business understanding of Markets products, especially those associated with the FX and Fixed Income Markets.
• Good communication skills to communicate both verbally and in writing with the various levels of staff as well as with the people on committees, and senior management.
• Effective negotiation skills, a proactive and 'no surprises' approach in communicating issues and strength in sustaining independent views. This individual must be an articulate and effective communicator, both orally and in writing, with an energetic, charismatic and approachable style.
• Strong interpersonal skills for interfacing with all levels of internal and external audit and management.
• Needs to be a self-motivator that likes being involved in identifying issues and willing to achieve the best result for the firm while adhering to global standards and requirements.

Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and experience.
Valuing Diversity: Demonstrates an appreciation of a diverse workforce. Appreciates differences in style or perspective or perspective and uses differences to add value to decisions or actions and organisational success.
Citi is an Equal Opportunities Employer


Please be informed that we will contact selected candidates only.
You are kindly requested to include the following clause in your application: “I hereby give my consent to the processing of my personal data included in my job application for the purpose of the recruitment process and after its completion for the purpose of future recruitments (pursuant to the Personal Data Protection Act as of 29 August 1997, Journal of Laws No. 133, item 883).

7944766205742073824.text:
Junior Accountant with Italian
Place of work: Katowice, Krakow
About us
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology and outsourcing services.
Capgemini Business Services department is one of the first and the biggest outsourcing centers in Poland providing services in 30 different languages in the areas of: finance, accounting, banking, procurement, customer care and marketing services. Business Services employs over 3800 specialists in its offices located in Krakow and Katowice.

Key responsibilities
~Correct and timely processing of financial data
~Processing purchase invoices and credit notes
~Analyzing the accounting documentation
~Correct and timely reporting
~Effective cooperation with Clients and colleagues


Ideal candidate profile
~At least intermediate level of English (min. B1)
~At least intermediate level of Italian (min. B1)
~Focus on details
~Good analytical skills
~Multitasking and ability to meet deadlines
~Working knowledge of MS Office tools (especially Excel)


What we offer
~Work in multinational company for c.a. 100 Blue Chip Clients- known, global brands, supported by 6000  professionals in 30 languages.
~Clearly defined career path  (experts or managers), wide range of trainings - over 20 000 online trainings and books also available at home, trainings in classroom, funding for learning foreign languages.
~You will learn best practices and global business from Capgemini experts. Over 900 certificated professionals in the field of PMP, SAP, ACCA, etc.
~You will work in an inspiring atmosphere. We work together and celebrate together- Capgemini Theatre, employee volunteer program, integration events, sports events (basketball, volleyball) - everyone will find something for themselves!
~In addition to the salary you will receive attractive benefit package  (medical care for whole family, life insurance). You can recommend friends in Referral Program  and collect awards!
~Our offices are conveniently located with “Bicycle-friendly” certificate!
~As a disabled person you will get professional support. We are open to provide assistive technologies for people with diverse disabilities. We care about inclusion and equal rights approach. We conduct disability awareness trainings. Join our Win with Capgemini Program for people with disabilities.

-8354343258714667558.title: Senior Finance & Accounting Process Specialist
-8354343258714667558.text:
Senior Finance & Accounting Process Specialist
Place of work: Krakow
About us
Capgemini is one of the world's foremost providers of consulting, technology and outsourcing services.
Capgemini Business Services department is one of the first and the biggest outsourcing centers in Poland providing services in 30 different languages in the areas of: finance, accounting, banking, procurement, customer care and marketing services. Business Services employs over 3800 specialists in its offices located in Krakow and Katowice.

Position purpose
New and interesting opportunity to work with a worldwide leader in Media & Entertainment. The company has operations around the globe and creates, distributes, markets and licenses all forms of entertainment from feature films to television, home video/DVD, international cinema, and broadcasting.
 We are looking for an experienced candidate, who is ready to be a part of Krakow Delivery Team - PTP processes.

Main accountabilities
~Vendor Query resolution
~Processing discrepancies resolution
~Maintaining close interactions with teams within PTP
~Responsibility for delivery agreed scope of work  
~Working closely with the client and maintaining good working relationship   
~Coordinating and escalating rush/emergency invoice requests from initial request to payment  
~Determining root cause of returned payments/payment rejections and provide resolution  
~Reviewing, researching and resolving to balance out debit/credit reports 
~Reviewing desktop procedures (DTPs) in conjunction with Global AP                 
~Performing pay audit
~Processing electronic and manual payments
~Preparing all ad-hoc, PTP-related tasks requested by management
~Researching and resolving Accounts Payable issues                                                            
~Determining if appropriate actions have been taken prior to escalation   
~Communicating resolution of item to Client within agreed upon time frames            
~Identifying root cause of repetitive problems                                           
~Proposing remedial actions to reduce future instances of repetitive problems  
~Work with territory business units to implement processes to resolve identified root causes       
~Engaging to provide AP subject matter expertise                                  
~Participating in scheduled status update calls with the client regarding operational issues          
~Monitoring business unit compliance with established AP Policies and Procedures          
~Working with business units to resolve areas of non-compliance


Requirements
~Very good knowledge of English
~Good knowledge of French or any other European language will be an asset
~Understanding and at least 1 year of experience in Accounts Payable is a must, knowledge of payment processes would be an asset. 
~SAP knowledge will be an asset
~Ability to analyze end to end processes
~Good knowledge of MS Office Strong interpersonal skills and proactive approach
~Ability to work under pressure
~Very good customer service skills and client-focus attitude
~Flexibility and ability to adapt to changing schedule of tasks


What we offer
~You will work in multinational, stable company for c.a. 100 Blue Chip Clients - known, global brands, supported by 6000 professionals in 30 languages.
~You will gain space to fulfill your ambitions and develop your career, opportunity to take part in transition projects. We operate according to Lean and Kaizen philosophy.
~You will choose your career path (experts or managers) – you will work among professionals (over 900). We will support you to gain knowledge (20 000 online trainings and in class) and get certified (e.g. ACCA, Prince2, PMP). You will have the opportunity to take part in coaching programs and develop your knowledge in experts communities.
~You will work in line with high, international work standards and you will have an opportunity to engage in CSR initiatives.
~You will be appreciated for your results and professionalism – based on clear rules of promotion. Our company applies a wide choice of perks (free private medical care for you and your family, additional life insurance). We help to keep right proportions between your work and private life (Business Parent Program).
~As a disabled person you will get professional support. We are open to provide assistive technologies for people with diverse disabilities. We care about inclusion and equal rights approach. We conduct disability awareness trainings. Join our Win with Capgemini Program for people with disabilities.


Interested candidates are invited to apply online.
Please be advised that Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. located in Warsaw, Al. Jerozolimskie 96, is the controller of personal data provided by you in the recruitment applications. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act of 29 August 1997 (Journal of Laws2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments) for the purpose of existing and future recruitment processes. Please be advised that in scope of recruitment process your personal data will be processed by the controller and sub-processors located outside European Economic Area including India’s entity. Data submission is voluntary. Every person has the right to access their data in order to correct it or delete it”
 Please include following statement in your application: "I hereby authorize Capgemini Poland Sp. z o.o. to process my personal data included in my job application for existing and future recruitment processes (in accordance with the Personal Data Protection August 1997, Journal of Laws 2002, No. 101, item. 926 with further amendments).I also authorize Capgemini Poland Sp z o.o. to sub-process my personal data outside European Economic Area including India’s entity, which may also include Capgemini’s clients within and outside of EEA."
 We protect your privacy. We kindly inform you that we contact only chosen candidates.The recruitment process is conducted in accordance with the principles of equal treatment in employment, Labor Code, Chapter IIa, Art. 183a– 183e.

4121943460215972605.text: Предлагаем удалённую работу в интернете без вложений средств. Распространять продукцию не потребуется совсем. Поэтому ни впаривания товаров кому бы то ни было, ни их продаж от вас не потребуется. Предлагаемый нами дополнительный заработок в интернете - это крайне хорошо оплачиваемый и очень стабильный вид дополнительного заработка. Работая на государство, вы вряд ли когда-нибудь будете чувствовать свою финансовую независимость и полную достаточность в наличных. Наша работа подходит абсолютно всем. Если заинтересовались, пишите мне на почту, обязательно отвечу всем на любые ваши вопросы.

8241024560406450217.title: Product Complaints Representative
8241024560406450217.text:
Did you know... ...there is a company whose associates choose to work there because their personal values align with the company’s core purpose of “Helping all people live healthy lives?”

"BD is a leading medical technology company that partners with customers and stakeholders to address many of the world’s most pressing and evolving health needs. Our innovative solutions are focused on improving medication management and patient safety; supporting infection prevention practices; equipping surgical and interventional procedures; improving drug delivery; aiding anesthesiology and respiratory care; advancing cellular research and applications; enhancing the diagnosis of infectious diseases and cancers; and supporting the management of diabetes. We are more than 45,000 associates in 50 countries who strive to fulfill our purpose of “Helping all people live healthy lives” by advancing the quality, accessibility, safety and affordability of healthcare around the world. In 2015, BD welcomed CareFusion and its products into the BD family of solutions. For more information on BD, please visit 

Product Complaints Representative

Main objective of role
~Receiving, capturing, translating and following customer’s product complaints in line with our Quality Management System and a standardized, end to end complaint handling process
~Management of product complaints and their follow-up in a timely and accurate manner with clear accountability for quality, compliance and data integrity
~Monitor follow-up and translate customer communication, to be able to serve and inform our customers in their local language

Requirements
~Advanced level knowledge of French/ Italian language required,
~Advanced level knowledge of English
~Experience in a Customer Facing environment would be a plus
~Min. 1 year experience in healthcare / medical- or pharma industry or service environment is a must
~Positive Quality attitude
~Degree level required (last-year students are also welcome),
~Strong customer focus and interpersonal skills,
~Excellent communication skills,
~Ability to work independently and manage time effectively,
~Familiarity with MS Office applications, like MS Excel,
~Willingness to work in detail oriented way and to seek for improvements

We are offering
~Working in an international company, first-in-class in its business area Opportunity for professional growth - challenging and rewarding work with a dynamic, international team
~New, modern offices in the city center developed to work and live healthy lives
~Friendly work environment and healthy oriented culture (healthy food, sport activities, participation in pro-health actions and events, charity initiatives)
~Competitive compensation and motivation system
~Great benefit package (e.g. health insurance, medical care, lunch vouchers, sport /entertainment bonus)


Please submit your CV and Cover Letter in English via ‘Apply now’ button below.


Make sure you insert the following statement along with your CV: "I hereby authorize you to process my personal data included in my job application for the needs of the recruitment process (in accordance with the Personnel Protection Act of 29.08.1997 no 133 position 883 with changes)"
We kindly inform that we will contact the selected candidates only.

-682697266155845827.title: Summer Internship in Gdansk
-682697266155845827.text:
State Street Corporation: Across the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. We keep our clients at the heart of everything we do, and smart, engaged employees are essential to our continued success.
Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.
At the moment we are looking for candidates for the position of
 Summer Internship in Gdansk JOB ID: 150531
 Location: Gdansk

to join the insource organization supporting the State Street EMEA
Why State Street Bank Poland?
Operating in Europe since 1970 State Street services clients in multiple locations. State Street Bank Poland was first established in 2007 in Kraków. Today State Street Bank Poland employs over 2500 staff members at three sites across the city and will now open a new office in Gdańsk. This will offer multiple opportunities to gain experience in diverse areas of the investment fund cycle as our Poland branch provides investment fund accounting and related services to clients of multiple State Street locations and business units across Europe. We offer positions in a challenging, rapidly changing and international environment. State Street offers a significant scope for personal growth and career progression. Throughout your career at State Street you will be provided with a wide range of training opportunities and internal mobility options as well as individual development plans, attractive benefits (including Employee Savings Plan) and an excellent remuneration package. The continuous development of our employees from day one is critical as we continually seek to develop and expand the local management team and create future leaders from within.
Job Description:
State Street’s Summer Internship Program provides an excellent opportunity to work and learn about our organization, our culture and how we do business on a day-to-day basis. Our 12-week internship program will allow you get firsthand experience in one of the following areas:
~Fund Accounting
~Hedge Fund Accounting
~Pricing
~Derivatives
~Financial Reporting
~Risk
~Compliance
~Middle Office
~Transfer Agency

We are also looking for candidates with French and Italian language skills!!
Apart from on-the-job training in the area you are assigned to you will join other interns in a coordinated training program that comprises of an induction program as well as a series of lunch and learn sessions that are geared towards providing you with an overview of our organization and our products. You will be paired up with a ‘buddy’ on day one who can offer you their experience, knowledge, and guidance throughout the summer. Very often, interns who perform and exceed expectations will be considered and propelled ahead of their peers in the interview process for full time graduate positions.
This year the summer internship runs from 1st July until 30th September.
Qualifications:
Candidates with below specifications may apply:
~We seek well-rounded students in their last years of studies (3rd year and above) with a combination of academic aptitude, proven leadership capabilities, and excellent communication skills
~Majoring in Finance, Accounting, or Economics (Business majors will also be considered)
~Demonstrate interest and competency in finance or Accounting
~Involved in student organizations would be an added advantage

To apply to this position, follow the "apply now" link. To locate this position in our application page, please use the KEYWORD search functionality and insert either the State Street Job ID or the Location.
As a first step we ask all candidates to fill out our online application form. Please enclose the CV in English and remember to save this document without any Polish characteristics also in file name.
To apply for the position please visit our website 
Job ID: 150531/   Location:   Gdańsk


State Street Bank Polska

5142429340003459384.title: Banking Transactions Specialist
5142429340003459384.text:
Citi Service Center (CSC) is an initiative to establish a network of service centers providing high quality services to other entities operating within the Citi Group.
Citi Service Center Poland was founded in 2005, and it currently employs over 3000 highly qualified staff in three locations: Warsaw, Olsztyn and Lodz. CSC cooperates with other Citi entities from all over the world.
Currently we provide services to over 60 countries in Europe, Asia, Africa, both Americas and Australia. Our employees use over 24 languages every day. Working in our organization involves working on international projects, in an international and dynamic environment as well as learning the top quality organizational culture.   Candidates interested in this job position are asked to apply by the Citi Careers Apply button below
  Read more about career opportunities at: careeratciti.pl or facebook.com/citigradsemea 

Citi Service Center Poland


 Banking Transactions Specialist

Work place: Warszawa
16081113
Description

Description:
SSA & MENA MIFT Call Back team is responsible for performing callback control for Africa and Middle East Citi branches. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring that day to day processing requirements are complete and controls are done and adhered to. Due to the differences in Middle East business requirements, there is a need to provide services on Sundays
Responsibilities:
~Conducting cooperation with foreign Africa and Middle East clients, in terms of serviced processes
~Receiving, verifying, performing controls in terms of payment details confirmation in a direct conversation with customers
~Keeping effective cooperation and communication with other Citi Service teams
~Implementing of own initiatives to improve performance quality and efficiency of the team - ability to identify ways to optimize the process
~Leading or participation in projects, including: participation in teleconferences, testing, documents verification
~Independence in resolving issues (i.e reporting system failures / applications). Coordination of the process changes implementation
~Analysis of operational errors. Initiating and implementing of corrective actions and improvements.
~Pro-active participation in migrating of new activities


Qualifications

Requiremenents:
~Very good knowledge of English and French - speaking and writing
~Knowledge of banking and finance as well as controls aspects will be additional advantage
~Good knowledge of Microsoft Office programs
~Strong focus on aspects of controls, risk assessment
~Self-reliance and responsibility in the performance of duties and solving problems
~Ability to work under pressure, creativity, analytical thinking skills, teamwork, responsibility, attention to detail, customer orientation
~Ability to work in a team and dealing with an international client
~Accuracy / precision / high quality work
~The ability to acquire and assimilate knowledge
~Very good communication skills


Please be informed that we will contact selected candidates only.
You are kindly requested to include the following clause in your application: “I hereby give my consent to the processing of my personal data included in my job application for the purpose of the recruitment process and after its completion for the purpose of future recruitments (pursuant to the Personal Data Protection Act as of 29 August 1997, Journal of Laws No. 133, item 883).

8890326864719905856.title: Derivatives Manager, Officer
8890326864719905856.text:
State Street Corporation: Across the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. We keep our clients at the heart of everything we do, and smart, engaged employees are essential to our continued success.
Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.
At the moment we are looking for candidates for the position of
 Derivatives Manager, Officer Job ID:   145734
Location: Gdansk

to join the insource organization supporting the State Street EMEA
Why State Street Bank Poland?
Operating in Europe since 1970 State Street services clients in multiple locations. State Street Bank Poland was first established in 2007 in Kraków. Today State Street Bank Poland employs over 2500 staff members at three sites across the city and will now open a new office in Gdańsk. This will offer multiple opportunities to gain experience in diverse areas of the investment fund cycle as our Poland branch provides investment fund accounting and related services to clients of multiple State Street locations and business units across Europe. We offer positions in a challenging, rapidly changing and international environment. State Street offers a significant scope for personal growth and career progression. Throughout your career at State Street you will be provided with a wide range of training opportunities and internal mobility options as well as individual development plans, attractive benefits (including Employee Savings Plan) and an excellent remuneration package. The continuous development of our employees from day one is critical as we continually seek to develop and expand the local management team and create future leaders from within.
Job Description:
Purpose Of Role:              
The Derivatives Manager is responsible for supervising services provided by the group headed by Team Supervisor, ensuring operational projects administration and execution, as well as identification of potential risk areas. The strong staff management and client servicing skills are required.
Specific Duties:
                Principal Tasks
•             Understands role of individual and department within Derivatives CoE and is able to navigate within department to achieve desired results.
•             Carries out daily responsibilities independently with minimal guidance and supervision.
•             Holds self and/or others accountable for achieving agreed-upon commitments, deadlines, or milestones.
•             Clearly communicates complex operational or technical subjects to internal or external clients, both in formal and informal settings.
•             Viewed by subordinates, superiors, and external clients as demonstrating maturity, professional conduct and common courtesy.
•             Supports and motivates others to reach goals.
•             Utilizes diverse workforce and talent to attain individual, team, and department goals
•             Shows a positive attitude in changing organizational situations
Leadership and Management
•             Lead and motivate staff, particularly direct reports.
•             Set and maintain standards of personal and professional performance/behaviour; ensuring staff accountability and adherence to company policies and procedures.
•             Co-ordinate and implement training and development activities for the Senior Associate(s) and/or A2s within your charge.
•             Provide coaching, guidance and support to Senior Associate(s) and /or A2s on technical, professional and client issues.
•             Agree goals for Senior Associate(s) and/or A2s & team annually and keep up to date on the PPR system during the year.
•             Monitor and appraise the performance of Senior Associate(s) and/or A2s - providing regular formal and informal feedback ensuring the PPR system is updated within corporate deadlines.
•             Manage resources & take responsibility for the recruitment of new staff.
 General Profile
•             Receives assignments in the form of objectives. Supervises subordinates and interacts with supervisors, other functional areas, management and internal/external clients to complete objectives. Makes decisions by applying department and company policies.
•             Develops  and directs work schedules and monitors work flow to achieve established goals and objectives for Derivatives CoE.
Knowledge Expertise
•             Thorough supervision of activities, impacts budgets, costs, and schedules. Responsible for recommending changes in guidelines, procedure, and policies: faulty decisions or failure to achieve results will cause delays and result in additional expenditure of time, human resources, and funds.
Working Relationships
•             Reporting to a Senior Fund Accounting Manager, responsible for a team/teams.  Second level of supervision to Team Supervisor.
•             Exposed to daily operational duties and any other non-business aspects that may influence department, e.g. personnel actions including employment, termination, performance reviews and performance improvement plans conduction.
Qualifications:
Specific Qualifications / Skills:
 •             Numeracy / Literacy skills
•             Confident in dealing with all situations; Excellent Communication; Organisational and Report Writing skills; Proficient in the use of MS Office tools including Word and Excel.
•             Proven experience of team management in a financial services environment.
Level Of Education:
                Primary Degree or a Professional or Accounting qualification or equivalent.
Previous Level Of Experience:
                4+ years working in the provision of fund administration services or have worked in another aspect of the Financial Services Industry for a number of years.
Skills     
Critical Behaviors for Success as defined
Core Competencies
•             Exercise sound judgment in all matters
•             Leverage knowledge and technology to ensure optimal results
•             Drive execution of all client and business related tasks
•             Provide outstanding service to all client/s - internally & externally
•             Communicate effectively at all levels within the organization
•             Display organizational insight & influence
•             Foster collaboration & team work
•             Develop talent
Disposition
•             Self-motivated
•             Enthusiastic
•             Leader / Motivator
•             Trustworthy
•             Self-reliant
•             Flexible
To apply to this position, follow the "apply now" link. To locate this position in our application page, please use the KEYWORD search functionality and insert either the State Street Job ID or the Location.
As a first step we ask all candidates to fill out our online application form. Please enclose the CV in English and remember to save this document without any Polish characteristics also in file name.
To apply for the position please visit our website 
Job ID: 145734/ Location: Gdańsk


State Street Bank Polska

8466683162783788188.company_name: Philip Morris International Service Center Europe
8466683162783788188.title: (Senior) HR Controlling & Accounting Analyst
8466683162783788188.text:
… SO APPLY AS 
(SENIOR) HR CONTROLLING & ACCOUNTING ANALYST
Location: Kraków
Are you curious, hungry to learn and to develop? Are you a great team player and will you make a difference to our company and your colleagues around you? If the answer is yes, then we’d like to hear from you.
WE ARE LOOKING TO RECRUIT
~a candidate with university degree in Finance or Economics;
~having at least 3 years of professional experience in the area of financial or payroll accounting, financial analysis or human resources administration;
~a strong analytical mindset, ambitious to constantly expand knowledge, challenge the status quo and enhance processes;
~a strong communicator who’s not afraid to reach out to stakeholders cross-functionally;
~a good English speaker and an excellent team player;
~ideally with good command of SAP and Excel.

RISE TO THE CHALLENGE
PMI Service Center Europe Sp. z o.o. (PMI SCE) is seeking talented people to join our team within the Finance Department based in Krakow, Poland.
As an HR Controlling & Accounting Analyst you will: 
~manage employment cost related accruals and reconcile employment cost related balance sheet accounts,
~analyze employment costs including social security and personal income taxes,
~develop expertise in the area of employment cost accounting, especially linked to international move of employees,
~have the opportunity to identify and propose process and system enhancements and contribute to their implementation,
~be part of an international organization and cooperate with a large number of internal and external stakeholders across countries. 

WE OFFER
~company kindergarten possibility
~private medical and dental care, life insurance
~subsidized meals in company canteens
~remote work opportunity and flexible working arrangements
~employee pension plan
~multisport program
~holiday, cultural & Christmas bonus
~wide range of trainings, optional language classes, further education and professional qualification support possibility
~free bike and car parking for all employees

JOIN A GLOBAL MARKET LEADER
Philip Morris International Inc. (PMI) is the leading international tobacco company, with seven of the world’s top 15 brands, including the number one cigarette brand worldwide.
PMI SCE was established in late 2005 in Krakow and since then is increasingly serving PMI affiliates’ Financial Accounting, Human Resources (HR), Supply Chain, Quality Assurance (QA),  Procurement and Information Services (IT) needs in Europe, Middle East and Africa.

Interested? Motivated? Apply on-line in English at
 by  02/11/2016
Please note that only on-line applications will be taken into consideration. Only selected candidates will be contacted.
